intro: Sempervivum balcanicum, commonly known as the Balkan houseleek, is a succulent plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically fleshy and covered in a whitish powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Sempervivum balcanicum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and low maintenance requirements.
